text:
I would like to have a job in a library. When I was little I met a women who was passionate about stories and books, I met also a group of readers and once a week, we’re seeing and presenting each other one of our favorites books. It was a safe place to me, I developed my general culture with this group.
A few years later, when Covid-19 arrived, my librarian said that she would like to open her own library (she was working on a bookstore). When her library gets done, I goes to see her every week and when I saw her happy to realized her dream, I was thinking that I could be like her too, that I could create my library, met readers and advised them, talked to them and discover what they liked and maybe they would give me some author’s names that I don’t know yet !
At first, I wanted to go in Paris to work in an English’s bookstore. I think that Paris is the best place to be an librarian. Indeed the atmosphere here is like magical, we can be who/what we want to be and I respect Paris for this. Then I choose to do my study in Paris, that a city not far from where I live and the fact that I can choose information communication would help me if I didn’t get a job in a bookstore because i could be a community manager.
I was also interested in this job because my generation lives with internet, smartphones and things like these. The social media is a sphere to meet new people, to learn about what is happening in the world, and I think that becoming a community manager for an editorial house could be interesting if i want to share some books that could be interesting to read or also interact with some readers to see what could be developed in the website or in the social media account.
So there is a lot of things that inspire me, my passion of reading, Alex Dupont my librarian, social medias…
